About Us
  
  

Return to Work Program – Engineer, Android or iOS ANZ Plus
  
  

5\.1/4\.4/4\.3 \- depending on skills and ability and rating after recruitment process
  
  

Ready to return to work, but need more support and flexibility?
  
  

ANZ's Return to Work Program is designed for people who have taken a career break or have been significantly underemployed and are seeking support to transition back into the workforce.
  
  

To be eligible for the Program you will have taken a career break (two or more years) or have been significantly underemployed.

At the heart of ANZ Plus is a talented, high\-performing team with big ideas. We’re building products, services and experiences that provide our customers with enhanced banking functionality and empower them to make better financial decisions to improve their financial wellbeing.
  
  

Banking is changing and we’re changing with it, giving our people great opportunities to try new things, learn and grow. Whatever your role at ANZ, you’ll be building your future, while helping to build ours.
  
  

**Role Type:** Permanent
  
**Role Location:** Melbourne, Australia
  
  

What will your day look like?
  
  

Site Reliability Engineers in ANZ Plus, use automation tools to monitor and observe software reliability in production.
  
  

Engineer, configure and design automation to ensure we are monitoring and measuring the health of technology platforms
  
Work collaboratively with other site reliability engineers and teams across ANZ Plus to continually drive down the cost of operations and increase efficiencies.
  
You will need to be comfortable with constantly learning new tools and techniques along with running proof of concept evaluations to keep us on the leading edge.
  
We will turn to you for suggestions on how to improve the platforms, processes, and tools!
  
Learn and share at our cloud guilds \& user groups, along with industry meetups.
  
What will you bring?
  
  

Your ability to learn and your interest in Site Reliability are more important than the software languages and tools you know.

Experience in coding in one or more languages (Go, Java, Python, or other scripting languages).
  
Some experience with common Infrastructure as Code tools. For example, Terraform or CloudFomation.
  
Continuous Integration / Deployment tools. For example, GitHub Actions, Jenkins, or BuildKite.
  
Cloud computing across one or more major public cloud providers. For example, GCP, AWS, or Azure.
  
Knowledge and interest in Kubernetes, or equivalent container orchestration tooling.
  
Experience working with operations and architecture groups developing scalable and supportable solutions
  
An interest working with common monitoring and observability tooling. For example, Honeycomb, Splunk, Dynatrace, etc.
  
  

While none of our engineers have all the skills above, they do all code!

From the moment you join ANZ, you'll be doing meaningful work that will shape a world where people and communities thrive.

title: Software Engineer
description:
* **About Amber**

  

Amber is a **new way to buy and sell power,** designed for a world powered by renewable energy. We give customers direct access to the real\-time wholesale electricity price as it varies every 5 mins. We then provide the technology to shift energy usage to the times when cheaper renewables are available in the grid and export to the grid at times when the price is highest. It’s a cheaper way to buy power, **a more rewarding way to sell power,** and the fastest way for Australia to reach 100% renewable energy.  

We are growing rapidly and have thousands of customers who love what we are doing and a great product that will play a significant role in driving Australia towards a renewable future. We are backed by **Australia’s leading VCs (including Square Peg Capital and Main Sequence Ventures)**, impact\-focused investors and individuals, and **most recently by Commonwealth Bank, NRMA and Gentrack**.  

We’re now at a critical moment in taking the business to real scale as we disrupt a huge market for the better. You’d be a part of a **rapidly growing team of over 140**, with expertise across energy, technology, marketing, and operations. We’re committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace and a great culture of people who love coming to work to build a better world. **About the role**  

Want to help improve the environment by shifting Australia’s energy usage towards renewables?  

We are currently hiring for **mid\-level Software Engineers.** Amber provides a great opportunity to apply your skills as an Engineer to help enable the uptake of renewable energy. Our technology optimises thousands of batteries and other devices in the customers' homes, enabling them to time their usage to consume power at times of high renewable penetration (and cheap prices), and then export power back to the grid at critical times \- letting them outbid coal and gas generators and earn potentially \>$100 in an afternoon. **The Amber Electric product team develops and supports:*** **Home automation integrations** (to batteries, hot water systems and pool pumps, with EVs coming soon) that control electricity usage in response to pricing and renewable availability
* **Mobile \& Web apps** for customers to monitor and manage their energy usage
* A **pricing and billing engine** for real time energy pricing
* The **marketing site and associated tools** to drive customer growth

  

The **tech stack** is **React Native mobile app**, some **React web frontends**, and a **Serverless Lambda backend on AWS**. We’re using **Typescript top to bottom**, and **Apollo GraphQL** sits in the middle. We keep our data in **DynamoDB** and **Timescale**, using one or the other as best suits a particular workload. **You can learn more about our tech stack at** **https://stackshare.io/companies/amber\-electric**  

While we’re looking for talented and driven individuals our desire is to build a champion team, not a team of champions. We’re full\-stack\-ish; while it’s impossible for everyone to excel across every layer of the stack we value people who can chip in wherever they’re needed. We’re committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace from the ground up. We want engineers who are as comfortable communicating with people as they are with their code.
### **Qualifications and Skills**

* At Amber, we want to hire self\-starters who are eager to learn, and are comfortable working in a changing environment
* You have a positive mindset: equal parts curious, collaborative, and can\-do
* **Between 3 and 5 years of commercial development experience in either Web or Mobile environments**
* Commercial experience with the specific technologies in our stack is a strong plus but not a hard requirement
* Experience with languages sharing features with **Typescript is also a plus (such as JavaScript, C\#, Go, or similar)**
* We **favour generalists** who can be or looking to be flexible across the stack, both frontend and backend
* Growing verbal and written communication skills built on a foundation of empathy for your fellow humans is essential

### **Your responsibilities**

* Write and maintain high quality program code across the stack in the areas of your speciality
* Flexibly contribute outside your speciality in other areas of the stack supporting your team when they need it
* Work collaboratively with your peers in product and across the wider company to ensure you're always shipping the right thing the right way at the right time
* Research, consult, analyse and evaluate our system requirements
* Test, debug, diagnose and correct errors in our tech stack according to our operational specifications
* Support the app across the whole lifecycle from idea through to production

### **Benefits**

* We’re committed to **building a diverse and inclusive workplace** and a great culture of people who love coming to work to build a better world
* You’d be a part of a **rapidly growing team of over 90** with expertise across energy, technology, marketing, and operations
* Be part of a **growing technology start\-up** that will shape the future of household renewable energy use
* **Flexible working hours** with provision for regular work from home arrangements and a central hub in Melbourne CBD
* We offset 100% of your carbon footprint for as long as you work with us (via Nul)
* Equitable gender\-neutral parental leave policies
* An external Employee Assistance Plan for mental health support
* Competitive salary and shares in Amber
* Annual Learning \& Development budget to support your personal growth


Range is quoted excluding superannuation. All roles at Amber include employee stock options.***This is a full\-time role to be based ideally from Melbourne, but we are also open to considering the right candidate anywhere within Australia.***  

***We are also open to working 4 days a week if that's what you are looking for. We mostly work from home, catching up in a co\-working space in the CBD every now and then. We expect to remain Melbourne based but maintain flexibility between the office and WFH.***  

**If this kind of work gets you excited, we'd love to hear from you!**  

Even if you don’t meet 100% of the requirements listed above, we still encourage you to apply. We're open to all backgrounds and encourage people from underrepresented groups to apply. We never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.  

✍️**How to Apply**
Please include your resume and a cover letter and tell us one specific way you could use your technical skills to improve a household's energy use under the Amber model. **Our process will generally be as follows:*** A screening interview with our talent team
* A take\-home technical challenge that should take no longer than four hours
* A follow up in person interview with two members of the engineering team
* A technical \+ culture interview with two of our Engineering Managers and/or Director of Engineering
* A final chat with one of the founders and the CTO

  

We promise to be respectful of your time as an applicant while trying to be as thorough as possible in finding the right fit for our team. **Applications only from candidates already based in Australia please. No recruitment firms.**

title: Staff Software Engineer
description:
### **Description**

  

**About Mutinex**  

We're an early\-stage B2B SaaS startup with a proven platform, big\-name clients, and millions in revenue. Mutinex helps marketers understand their ROI and make smarter decisions with their budget.  

We're a hybrid team based in Sydney, Melbourne, and New York. We value communication, open\-mindedness, and a culture of feedback. All staff receive equity (ESOP), and we offer increasing annual leave based on tenure.### **The role**

  

As a Staff\+ Software Engineer on our Internal Tooling team, you'll be instrumental in driving efficiency and effectiveness across Mutinex. You’ll be at the forefront of leveraging AI, particularly agentic AI, to automate internal business processes, build and own shared infrastructure, and create tooling that empowers our Product and Engineering teams. This is a high\-impact role where you’ll shape the future of our internal operations and development environment, and have a significant influence on our overall productivity and culture.  

**Role Responsibilities:*** **AI\-Powered Tooling Development:** Design, develop, and deploy AI\-driven tools and automation to streamline internal workflows, both within engineering and across the broader organization. This includes exploring and implementing agentic AI solutions to automate complex tasks and improve overall efficiency.
* **Shared Infrastructure Ownership:** Own and maintain critical shared infrastructure components, ensuring their reliability, scalability, and security. This involves designing and implementing infrastructure\-as\-code, monitoring, and alerting solutions.
* **Internal Process Automation:** Identify opportunities to automate manual processes across the organization, including but not limited to engineering. Implement solutions that reduce toil, improve efficiency, and accelerate operational effectiveness.
* **Collaboration and Enablement:** Work closely with Product, Engineering, and other teams (e.g., Marketing, Sales) to understand their needs and develop tooling solutions that address their pain points. Provide guidance and support to ensure effective adoption of new tools and technologies.
* **Technical Leadership:** Provide technical leadership and mentorship to other engineers on the team. Promote best practices in software development, AI implementation, and infrastructure management.
* **Research and Innovation:** Stay up\-to\-date with the latest advancements in AI, software development, and DevOps. Proactively explore new technologies and approaches to improve our internal tooling and business processes.

  

### **What we are looking for**

  

* **Software Engineer at Heart:** You have 5\+ years of experience in software engineering, with a strong foundation in computer science principles, and a passion for building tools and automation solutions.
* **AI Enthusiasm:** You are passionate about AI and its potential to transform internal operations. You have a strong interest in exploring and implementing agentic AI solutions.
* **Cloud Proficiency:** You have extensive experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure) and a deep understanding of cloud\-native technologies.
* **Automation Mindset:** You have a strong desire to automate everything. You are skilled in implementing automation solutions using a variety of tools and technologies.
* **DevOps Expertise:** You have a solid understanding of DevOps principles and practices. You are experienced with infrastructure\-as\-code, CI/CD, and monitoring tools.
* **Technical Leadership:** You have a proven track record of providing technical leadership and mentorship to other engineers.
* **Excellent Communicator:** You can effectively communicate technical concepts to both technical and non\-technical audiences.
* **Proactive Problem Solver:** You can identify and solve complex challenges, taking a proactive and analytical approach.

  

### **About Mutinex**


We might be an early stage startup but we already have strong product market fit, household name clients (Samsung, Mars, CUB and ING to name a few) and millions in revenue.  

  

Being early stage means we're also still pretty scrappy and you wouldn't be coming into a well oiled machine, yet. But you would get a lot of opportunity to design, build and oil the machine until it's super oily.  

  

We aren't aiming to be another Tech Unicorn because Unicorns aren't real. We are aiming (and confident of being) more like a real and really big animal that lives for a long time, like a Bowhead Whale.  

  

Mutinex is a startup B2B SaaS platform that provides in\-depth data analytics for marketers to better understand their ROI and make better decisions with future spend.  

Founded in Australia, we've hit millions in ARR \& have seed funding ($5 million in May 2023 \& $9\.5 million in October 2023 backed by EVP) that we'll use for growing our team to continue to improve our product, bring in new customers and enable them to make better and more informed decisions.
  

We have a hybrid work environment with teams in Sydney, Melbourne and expanding into the US.  

  

With a team of around 60 people we value high quality communication, strong opinions that are held loosely and people who can give and take feedback well.  

  

Equity (ESOP) is offered to all staff on top of their salary and we also offer additional annual leave after 1 year of tenure (from 20 to 25 days a year) that continues to grow another day each year of service until you max out at 30 days per year.

Our **Connected Technology Group (CTG)** defines and drives the digital, data and technology strategy for KPMG. We cultivate collaboration and integrate tech execution across our business, driving a firmwide approach to how we go\-to\-market and build the capability of our people and attract new talent.


Trusted AI represents KPMG’s strategic approach and commitment to the responsible and ethical design, development, procurement, and use of artificial intelligence. By implementing Trusted AI, we aim to accelerate value creation for our clients, the firm, and society, all while promoting trust and confidence in AI systems throughout every stage of their lifecycle. The KPMG Trusted AI Framework rests on three foundational principles of being values\-driven, human\-centric and trustworthy, supported by ten key ethical principles. The KPMG Australia Trusted AI Office is responsible for operationalising the firm’s Trusted AI Framework in line with emerging regulatory requirements, global standards and industry best practice.

**Your Opportunity**


The purpose of the Responsible AI Data Science Engineer role is to support the operationalisation of best practice human\-centred and trusted AI approaches in the design, development, assessment and monitoring of AI solutions.

* Define and oversee the implementation of metrics for the design, testing and ongoing monitoring of AI solutions against key responsible AI pillars, including fairness, reliability, privacy, security and sustainability;
* Actively engage with digital delivery teams to evaluate their upcoming product and project releases, ensuring alignment with responsible AI principles and identification of potential risks;
* Establish a deep understanding of generative AI technology, Digital FTE use cases and practical Trusted AI implementations; and
* Collaborate in the development and execution of a Trusted AI by Design approach to building, testing, deploying and monitoring AI solutions

**How are you extraordinary?**

* **Adaptability**: Keeping pace with the rapidly changing AI industry and regulatory landscape requires a flexible mindset and a commitment to ongoing learning.
* **Communication**: Articulating complex AI concepts clearly to both technical and non\-technical stakeholders is key.
* **Collaboration**: Forming effective partnerships with teams and guiding the integration of responsible AI principles into AI solutions is crucial.

**Your Skills \& Experience**

* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in computer science, AI/ML, advanced data analytics or related technical fields
* Minimum 4\-6 years’ experience
* Experience in designing, developing and deploying AI solutions.
* Experience in identifying, assessing and mitigating risks across the AI lifecycle
* Experience in defining metrics, testing, and monitoring the implementation of responsible AI specifications within an AI solution.
* Experience in working on cloud and on Data \& AI technologies.
* Knowledge of standard IT operations including MLOps, LLMOps and DevOps.

* Strong communication skills, both written and spoken, with the ability to engage with technical as well as non\-technical audiences.

We do this by over\-delivering through our commitment to fun, challenging the status quo and living our values. * + 2\+ years’ experience in a marketing operations or equivalent role where you have worked with and improved marketing technology tools

* 25 days annual leave (that’s right, a whole extra week!)

We encourage you to apply as soon as possible as we review candidates within 2 weeks of advertising. Be sure to check out our Life@Sportsbet Instagram page, Sportsbet LinkedIn page as well our careers website for more information and insight into our culture.

Well, it’s different for everyone, yet unites us all. It’s the feeling you get when you succeed, no matter what success looks like to you. Rio Tinto is a leading global mining and materials company. We operate in 35 countries where we produce iron ore, copper, aluminium, critical minerals, and other materials needed for the global energy transition and for people, communities, and nations to thrive.

description:
Due to an internal promotion, this role is open for someone who is hungry to support a data led commercial function across all people, process, strategy and operations fronts within our Marketing department.

  

**About Us**

  


At Sportsbet, we’re united behind our purpose to “Bring Excitement to Life” for our 2 million customers (and growing!). We do this by over\-delivering through our commitment to fun, challenging the status quo and living our values. As part of the Flutter Group, we’re a global player, but in Melbourne, Sydney and Darwin we’re a tight knit group of 1,300 teammates (of which over half are in our Tech and Data Science teams!).

  



We are a significant contributor to the Australian economy through racing and sporting codes and we are committed to having a positive impact in society by supporting our customers, our communities and our employees. Our commitment to responsible gambling is genuine and demonstrated through the wide range of responsible gambling initiatives and tools.

  


**About The Role**



Reporting into the Audience \& Tracking Manager, as an Analytics Specialist you will be working alongside a Marketing Technology (MarTech) product and delivery team as an internal SME for Marketing platform. This role will focus on leveraging digital analytics to drive strategic decision\-making, optimize digital assets, and improve customer experiences. The successful candidate will act as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) in digital analytics and collaborate cross\-functionally to enhance data utilization across the organization.



We are looking for someone who is excited by the growing MarTech domain, who wants their days filled with innovation, strategy work and plenty of engagement with a fun team. Someone who is interested by technology, tracking and data but not a developer.


**Responsibilities Include:**


* Develop and implement audience segmentation strategies’ by leveraging first\-party data to create customer cohorts.
* Develop and integrate a unified digital customer profile, making analytics and insights actionable for strategic decision\-making.
* Review platform pain points from the teams and help to enable solutions.
* Research and formulate direction for upcoming changes in industry and regulation.
* Work closely with marketing, product, and technology teams to ensure audience and analytics implementation aligns with business needs.
* Build and maintain a robust digital data layer that is coherent, transparent, and accessible for cross\-functional teams.
* Foster a data\-driven culture by developing advanced analytics strategies, building data pipelines, and ensuring effective data utilization across teams.
* Conduct E2E testing of audience cohorts and analytics implementation, ensuring data accuracy, debugging discrepancies and collaborating with tech teams to resolve issues.

  


**About You**


* + 2\+ years’ experience in a marketing operations or equivalent role where you have worked with and improved marketing technology tools
	+ Deep knowledge of CDP, Marketing automation and Adtech tools
	+ Expertise in tracking and attribution
	+ Experience with analytics tool like Google Analytics (or similar) and running SQL
  


**The Perks**



We work hard and play hard, so along with a competitive salary and generous performance\-based bonus, here’s some of our other perks:


* 25 days annual leave (that’s right, a whole extra week!)
* Genuine flexible working policy with a $800 work from home office allowance
* Weekly concierge service including free massages, manicure/nail appointments – all onsite!
* Daily fresh fruit, free breakfast, sparkling water and Kombucha on tap in the office (did we mention we have a bar fridge for Thursday night drinks!?)
* Development budget to send you to conferences, events, courses and other learning opportunities.
* End of trip facilities with an onsite table tennis and pool table
* Access to our Employee Assistance Program and a Circle In membership
* Industry leading Parental Leave support program with 26 weeks paid leave for Primary Carers and no wait time. We also have a progressive return to work benefit for your first 6 months back: come back for 3 days, get paid for 4; come back for 4 days, get paid for 5\.

  



We encourage you to apply as soon as possible as we review candidates within 2 weeks of advertising. Be sure to check out our Life@Sportsbet Instagram page, Sportsbet LinkedIn page as well our careers website for more information and insight into our culture.

  


**What’s the Green Tick Feeling?**

  


Well, it’s different for everyone, yet unites us all. It’s the feeling you get when you succeed, no matter what success looks like to you. It could be developing your career, it could working on an industry leading project, or it could be making it to school pick up in time. It's all the little and big things that make you feel like you’re thriving when working at Sportsbet.

  



We’re an inclusive employer who welcomes you for who you are, as you are – so, if you require adjustments to the recruitment process, please let us know in your application. We also know flex means different things to different people, so let us know how we can support you to be your best.

  


**Ready for your Green Tick Feeling? Apply now**

**About the role**


We are looking for a Principal People Analytics Partner to be a strategic advisor to HR and business leaders, applying advanced statistical techniques and organizational psychology principles to solve complex workforce challenges.


You will also play a key role in ensuring data consistency and quality, working closely with HR data owners to establish reliable data foundations for analytics and decision\-making. This role requires a deep understanding of people data, strong stakeholder management skills, and the ability to translate analytical findings into actionable insights.


We are an open, connected global team that includes some of the industry’s best and brightest minds. We offer competitive, performance\-focused remuneration and a wide range of benefits to reward your contribution. With a global reach, the opportunities to develop and grow your career are broad and exciting.


Reporting to Senior Manager Data \& Insights you will:

* Design employee research efforts incorporating organisational data, employee listening and external bodies of knowledge such as academic and consultant publications.
* Data Storytelling \& Visualization: Translate complex analytics into clear, compelling narratives using tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Python/R visualizations
* Consult \& Advise: Partner with HR, business leaders, and key stakeholders to understand People challenges and develop data\-driven solutions.
* Stakeholder Engagement: Partner with stakeholders and supporting teams to identify, diagnose and solve critical problems with technical delivery, including short and long\-term solutions to deliver sustainable outcomes.
* Education: train and educate stakeholders in the People Function on analytics tools and data driven decision making.

* Continuous Learning \& Innovation: Stay ahead of industry trends, research methodologies, and technological advancements in people analytics.
* Maintain and deliver excellence in knowledge management for analytics tools development by using collaboration tools and industry standard project documentation approaches.

* A commitment to the safety of yourself and your team,
* Master’s degree in Organizational Psychology, Statistics, Data Science, Human Resource Management, Business Analytics, or a related field required. PhD strongly preferred.
* 5\+ years in People Analytics, Organizational Research, or HR Data Science roles.
* Strong expertise in statistical analysis, machine learning, and predictive modelling.
* Proficiency in R, Python, SQL, or similar tools for data analysis.
* Experience with HRIS, survey platforms, and business intelligence tools (e.g., Workday, Qualtrics, Power BI, Tableau).
* Experience conducting applied research in an organizational setting.
* Experience working with HR data owners to establish data definitions, improve quality, and ensure consistency.
* Passion for gaining insights from data. Excited by the opportunity to generate value through strong connections between business problems and deep technical expertise in data analytics.
* Demonstrated experience as a team player, with the ability to inspire and partner with others by influence. Able to bring together diverse, multi\-disciplined teams to successfully deliver projects.
* Have an ability to communicate complex concepts to a diverse range of stakeholders, building support and buy\-in for projects and approaches – delivering clear articulate messages and recommendations.
* Encompass endless curiosity and commitment to continuous learning, specifically in the fields of applied data science and analytics to business problems.
* Have customer\-focused and responsive \- outstanding customer engagement skills and proven project delivery capability. Flexible thinker \& agile approach.

* A permanent position working directly for Rio Tinto

This role can be based in our Brisbane, Perth, Montreal, Ulaanbaatar or Gurgaon Hubs.
